text: Lulu Roman (or Bertha Louise Hable; May 6, 1946 – April 23, 2025) was an American comedian and singer. She acted in the television comedy Hee Haw. She sings mostly gospel music. In 1984, Roman received a Dove Award from the Gospel Music Association for her album You were Loving Me.Encyclopedia of Contemporary Christian Music: Pop, Rock, and Worship, ed. Don Cusic (Santa Barbara, CA: Greenwood Press, 2010), p. 120 In 2003 she was the author of a book titled Kitchen Komforts.Lulu Roman, Kitchen Komforts: fabulous comfort food recipes and inspiring short stories to nourish the body and soul (Nashville, TN: Cumberland House, 2003) Roman was born in Dallas, Texas.Encyclopedia of American Gospel Music, ed. W. K. McNeil (London; New York: Routledge, 2005), p. 324 She died on April 23, 2025 in Bellingham, Washington at the age of 78.Lulu Roman, Popular ‘Hee Haw’ Comedian and Gospel Singer, Dies at 78 ==References== Category:1946 births Category:2025 deaths Category:American television actors Category:Musicians from Dallas Category:Comedians from Dallas Category:American gospel musicians
